message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.NE. 

The paper focuses on using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) to solve abstract reasoning problems, which is a common topic in computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed Hierarchical Rule Induction Network (HriNet) involves multiple levels of rule embeddings and a gated embedding fusion module, which are techniques commonly used in deep learning and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also introduces a rule similarity metric, which involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as word embeddings, and can be categorized under computational linguistics (cs.CL). Finally, the paper uses a tuplet loss and similarity score to train and evaluate the model, which are techniques commonly used in neural networks (cs.NE).
